title: Why Are Game Sounds So Quiet in Oce Pro Commentaries?
body:
I'm a gamer and a music producer and can't help but feel disappointed every time I watch Oce Pro matches.

The sound effects are sooo quiet compared to other regions like NA which makes watching them sooo much more lifeless, and even boring. Watching NA LCS is engaging, it feels like your in the action. Oce feels like your just in the distance, with people talking and a game in the background, which is an issue.

The commentary should be supplementing the game, not the reverse.

It's such a simple thing to fix too. Turn commentary down, or turn the sound effects up.

Please fix this? It will only benefit Lol Esports in Oceania.

replies.body:
Hey Thund3rBOLT - really good feedback. You explained why you posed the initial question which gives us a greater insight into the comment. Thanks!!

Let this note serve as a 'we hear you' - I'm passing it on to our broadcast team.

Cheers!

Ok so we are going to turn it up this week in the OPL - if you could let me know if you think its loud enough after the games this weekend, I'm keen to hear.

Cheers

Soo much better.

Thanks to you and the broadcast team!
Excellent! thanks for providing the initial feedback

Hopefully, I'll be able to tune in and see.

Thank you Belquin!

I think a reason for this might be because NA, EU, Korea all have crowds which come and watch their LCS games, whereas OCE is still played in riot games studio, so you don't get to hear the people in the background like you would in the LCS.

I should clarify. I'm talking about sounds from summoners rift that are too quiet. Champion taunts, flashes, abilities, etc... They are so quiet compared to the commentary.

It makes the game sink into the background while we're listening to two or three people blabble about what we are seeing, but not hearing.
